newsitem.title: USA: BMC Software buys DataTools for $60 mln.
newsitem.headline: BMC Software buys DataTools for $60 mln.

text.p: BMC Software Inc said Wednesday it has exercised its option to buy DataTools Inc, a private company that develops enterprise backup and recovery solutions, for $60 million cash.
BMC, which makes computer software for business management, said the acquisition expands its existing backup and recovery solutions.
The company bought the option to buy DataTools two years ago and became the sole distributor of the company's backup and recovery products.

"Together, we have developed complementary products with significant functionality enhancements. Building on these successes, we believe now is the opportune time to combine our backup and recovery development initiatives and accelerate the integration of our product lines," said Max Watson, BMC's chairman, president and chief executive.
